words.definition: If you do something awhile, you do it for a short time.
words.example: Wait here awhile.

words.definition: Cyberspace is the world of information on the Internet.
words.example: He spends a lot of time in cyberspace.

words.definition: To edit means to prepare text for publication by correcting errors.
words.example: I need to edit my essay before I turn it in.

words.definition: An essay is a short piece of writing on a particular subject.
words.example: She wrote an essay about her summer vacation.

words.definition: To evaluate means to judge the value or quality of something.
words.example: The teacher will evaluate our presentations.

words.definition: To faint means to lose consciousness for a short time.
words.example: She fainted from the heat.

words.definition: If something is global, it relates to the whole world.
words.example: Pollution is a global problem.

words.definition: A gymnasium is a building or room for physical exercise.
words.example: We played basketball in the gymnasium.

words.definition: To highlight means to draw attention to something important.
words.example: The speaker highlighted the main points of his speech.

words.definition: If someone is ignorant, they lack knowledge or information about something.
words.example: He was ignorant of the new rules.

words.definition: An index is an alphabetical list of topics in a book.
words.example: I looked up the word in the index.

words.definition: A lecture is a formal talk on a serious subject.
words.example: The professor gave a lecture on history.

words.definition: If something is moral, it relates to what is right and wrong.
words.example: He is a man of high moral standards.

words.definition: To operate means to control the functioning of a machine.
words.example: He knows how to operate the tractor.

words.definition: If something is private, it is only for one person or group.
words.example: This is a private conversation.

words.definition: If something is recent, it happened or started a short time ago.
words.example: Have you seen any good movies recently?

words.definition: A resolution is a formal decision to do something.
words.example: My New Year's resolution is to exercise more.

words.definition: A semester is one of the two periods into which a school year is divided.
words.example: I am taking five classes this semester.

words.definition: If something is typewritten, it is written using a typewriter or computer.
words.example: The report was typewritten and professional.

words.definition: If something is weird, it is very strange or unusual.
words.example: I had a weird dream last night.
